metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32257 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernel SMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing of SMB2_SESSION_SETUP and SMB2_LOGOFF commands. The issue results from the lack of proper locking when performing operations on an object. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel. Quentin Minster discovered that a race condition existed in the KSMBD implementation in the Linux kernel when handling sessions operations. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32257` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic-lpae - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-aws - 6.5.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> also kwnon as ZDI-23-705, ZDI-CAN-20596 needs ksmbd-tools installed to enable the service, which is not installed by default. same fix as CVE-2023-32252, CVE-2023-32250
